meanings.definition: Capable of being spared or saved.
meanings.sent1: The extra pencils were spareable for future use.
meanings.sent2: It is good to have spareable time in case of emergencies.
meanings.sent3: The spareable cookies were left untouched by the mischievous children.
meanings.sent4: Her spareable kindness shone brightly in times of need.
meanings.sent5: The spareable umbrella saved him from getting wet in the sudden rain.

meanings.definition: Able to be set aside or left unused.
meanings.sent1: The spareable clothes were neatly folded in the closet.
meanings.sent2: She always kept spareable change in her purse for parking meters.
meanings.sent3: The spareable vacation days were a pleasant surprise.
meanings.sent4: His spareable energy allowed him to finish the project ahead of time.
meanings.sent5: The spareable room in the suitcase was perfect for souvenirs from the trip.
